BCEM Achieves Record Clean Energy Generation in Q4 2024
Burj Clean Energy Modaraba reports significant growth in renewable energy output, contributing to Pakistan's sustainable energy goals.
Wind turbines at sunset generating clean energy

Burj Clean Energy Modaraba (BCEM) is pleased to announce record-breaking clean energy generation figures for the fourth quarter of 2024, marking a significant milestone in the company's mission to provide sustainable, Shariah-compliant energy solutions.

## Key Highlights

The quarter saw exceptional performance across all operational projects, with total generation capacity increasing substantially compared to the same period last year. This growth reflects our continued commitment to expanding Pakistan's renewable energy infrastructure.

## Impact on Sustainability Goals

Our wind and solar projects continue to contribute meaningfully to Pakistan's national renewable energy targets, helping reduce carbon emissions while providing reliable, clean electricity to the national grid.

## Looking Ahead

As we enter 2025, BCEM remains focused on expanding our portfolio of renewable energy assets while maintaining the highest standards of Shariah compliance and corporate governance.

For more information, please contact our Investor Relations department.

A flagship wind power installation in the Jhimpir wind corridor, contributing clean energy to Pakistan's national grid.
Wind turbines at the Jhimpir Wind Power Project

The Jhimpir Wind Power Project represents a cornerstone of BCEM's renewable energy portfolio, harnessing the exceptional wind resources of the Jhimpir wind corridor in Sindh province.

## Project Overview

Located in one of Pakistan's most promising wind energy zones, this project utilizes state-of-the-art wind turbine technology to generate clean, reliable electricity. The consistent wind patterns in this region ensure optimal energy production throughout the year.

## Technical Specifications

The project features modern wind turbines designed for the specific wind conditions of the Jhimpir corridor. Each turbine is equipped with advanced monitoring systems to ensure maximum efficiency and reliability.

## Environmental Impact

By generating clean electricity, this project contributes significantly to reducing Pakistan's carbon footprint. The annual CO₂ offset is equivalent to removing thousands of vehicles from the road.

## Community Benefits

Beyond clean energy generation, the project has created local employment opportunities and contributed to the economic development of the surrounding communities.

A solar energy project supplying clean power to Power Cement Ltd, reducing reliance on the grid and cutting emissions.
Solar farm at Power Cement Ltd

The Power Cement Ltd project delivers reliable, clean energy through Solar, supporting cement production while reducing environmental impact.

## Project Overview

This installation generates 7 MW of electricity from solar energy, providing stable power to Power Cement Ltd's operations.

## Technical Specifications

The system integrates 13,000 solar panels generating 540W each.

## Environmental Impact

By utilizing solar energy the project offsets a significant amount of CO₂ emissions and reduces grid demand.

## Community Benefits

Stable on-site generation strengthens local energy reliability and supports jobs through ongoing operations and maintenance.
